item.title: Trump Tax Bill Advances After GOP Deal for Faster Medicaid Cuts
item.description: A key House committee advanced President Donald Trump’s giant tax and spending package after Republican hardliners won agreement from party leaders to speed up cuts to Medicaid health coverage.
item.dc:creator: Emily Birnbaum, Jarrell Dillard, Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump Photographer: Bonnie Cash/UPI

item.title: Mini ‘Sell America’ Trade Revived After Moody’s Downgrades US
item.description: Investors faced yet another bumpy start to the trading week with US assets coming under fresh pressure, although it’s mounting concern over American debt rather than tariffs generating the volatility this time.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova, Carmen Reinicke, Anya Andrianova

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, May 15, 2025. US stocks were on pace to snap a three-day winning streak Thursday, driven by declines in technology, energy and retailers as traders assessed a slew of mixed economic figures.

item.title: Japan’s Ishiba Says Won’t Fixate on US Trade Talk Time Limits
item.description: Japan won’t compromise its national interests in trade talks with the US by fixating on time limits, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said, signaling Tokyo isn’t rushing into an agreement.
item.dc:creator: Yoshiaki Nohara

media:content.media:description: Shigeru Ishiba Photographer: Anna Rose Layden/UPI

item.title: Ishiba Rebuffs Tax Cut Demands With Greek Debt Comparison
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba rebuffed calls for tax cuts saying that the nation’s financial conditions are worse than Greece’s.
item.dc:creator: Yoshiaki Nohara

item.title: Authorities Identify Suspect in Palm Springs Fertility Clinic Explosion
item.description: A 25-year-old man the FBI believes was responsible for an explosion that ripped through a Southern California fertility clinic left behind “anti-pro-life” writings before carrying out an attack investigators called terrorism, authorities said Sunday.

media:content.media:description: Investigators document the scene at the front of the American Reproductive Centers fertility clinic following a bomb blast in Palm Springs, California, on May 17, 2025.

item.title: China Tells Officials to Rein in Alcohol, Cigarette Spending
item.description: China reminded officials around the country to cut wasteful spending on travel, food and office space, adding to signs of an austerity push by President Xi Jinping as economic headwinds strain government budgets.
item.dc:creator: Philip Glamann

media:content.media:description: Xi Jinping Photographer: Pool/Getty Images

item.title: Japan PM Ishiba’s Support Falls, No Ouster Seen Before July
item.description: Support for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s government weakened, according to public opinion surveys published by major Japanese news organizations over the weekend, although it remains unlikely he’ll be ousted before a national election in July.
item.dc:creator: Alastair Gale

media:content.media:description: Shigeru Ishiba Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Polish Ballot Set to Jolt Zloty as Pro-EU Front-Runner Pressured
item.description: A stronger-than-expected showing by opposition populists in the first round of Poland’s presidential election will test investor appetite for the country’s assets.
item.dc:creator: Konrad Krasuski, Agnieszka Barteczko

media:content.media:description: Rafal Trzaskowski, mayor of Warsaw, center, waves a Polish flag during an election night rally in Sandomierz, Poland, on Sunday, May 18, 2025. Trzaskowski, the centrist Warsaw mayor, and Karol Nawrocki, a pro-Donald Trump nationalist, came neck-and-neck in the first round of Poland's presidential election, according to an exit poll, in a blow to the pro-European government.

item.title: China-US Trade Truce Prompts Nations to Consider Tougher Tactics
item.description: China’s defiant stance in negotiating a tariff truce with the US has convinced some countries they need to take a tougher position in their own trade talks with the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Katia Dmitrieva

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump during a Congressional resolution signing in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, DC, on May 9.

item.title: South Korean Election Favorite Sees No Need to Rush for US Deal
item.description: South Korea’s leading presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung said there’s no need to rush into an early agreement in trade negotiations with the US, criticizing the interim government for what he called its hasty engagement with the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Soo-Hyang Choi

media:content.media:description: Lee Jae-myung Photographer: Woohae Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: Milei Wins Big in Buenos Aires City Vote, Dethroning Macri
item.description: Javier Milei struck at the heart of his former ally’s biggest bastion of support and came out victorious in the city of Buenos Aires, cementing his hold on Argentina’s political right months before pivotal midterm elections.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: Javier Milei Photographer: Emiliano Lasalvia/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: China Gave Pakistan Satellite Support, Indian Defense Group Says
item.description: China provided Pakistan with air defense and satellite support during its clash with India this month, according to a research group under India’s Ministry of Defence, suggesting that Beijing was more directly involved in the conflict than was previously disclosed.
item.dc:creator: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Dan Strumpf

media:content.media:description: A motorcyclist rides past shattered glasses of a restaurant outside the Rawalpindi cricket stadium after an alleged drone was shot down in Rawalpindi on May 8, 2025. India and Pakistan accused each other on May 8 of carrying out waves of drone attacks, as deadly confrontations between the nuclear-armed foes drew global calls for calm. Pakistan's army said it shot down 25 Indian drones, while New Delhi accused Islamabad of launching overnight raids with "drones and missiles", and claimed it destroyed an air defence system in Lahore. (Photo by Aamir QURESHI / AFP) (Photo by AAMIR QURESHI/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Portugal’s Center Right Wins Vote But Falls Short of Majority
item.description: Portugal’s ruling center-right coalition won a snap election Sunday in a vote that saw the far-right and the Socialists compete neck-and-neck for second place, rocking the two-party system that’s dominated the country’s political life for 50 years.
item.dc:creator: Joao Lima, Henrique Almeida

item.title: Warsaw Mayor to Face Populist in Polish Presidential Runoff
item.description: The mayor of Warsaw was poised for a narrow win over a pro-Donald Trump nationalist in the first round of Poland’s presidential election that is critical for the pro-European government’s agenda to undo years of populist rule.
item.dc:creator: Wojciech Moskwa, Natalia Ojewska

media:content.media:description: Rafal Trzaskowski during an election night rally in Sandomierz, Poland, on Sunday.

item.title: Putin Heads Into Trump Call Confident That Russia Has Upper Hand
item.description: Vladimir Putin believes he has a strong hand ahead of a phone call Monday with Donald Trump and European leaders are trying to prevent the US president from rushing through a deal.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Drozdiak, Ben Sills

media:content.media:description: Vladimir Putin chairs the Security Council meeting via videoconference at the Kremlin in Moscow, Russia, in this handout photo release by Russian state agency Sputnik, on May 16.

item.title: Biden Is Diagnosed With ‘Aggressive’ Form of Prostate Cancer
item.description: Former US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer, his office announced.
item.dc:creator: Wendy Benjaminson, Skylar Woodhouse

media:content.media:description: Former President Joe Biden

item.title: Israeli Strikes Across Gaza Kill at Least 103 People, Medics Say
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel announced Sunday it will allow a limited amount of humanitarian aid into Gaza after a nearly three-month blockade, days after global experts on food security warned of famine.

media:content.media:description: Search and rescue teams work under the rubble after the Israeli army attacked a building at the Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip on May 18.

item.title: UK and EU Poised to Grasp Post-Brexit Reset as Talks Go to Wire
item.description: UK and European Union negotiators worked into Sunday evening in a bid to reset post-Brexit relations under Keir Starmer’s new Labour government ahead of a summit in London.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli

media:content.media:description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, left, and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer meet last month in Downing Street.

item.title: Romanian Centrist Scores Victory Over Far-Right Trump Loyalist
item.description: The centrist mayor of Bucharest won Romania’s presidential runoff on Sunday, quashing the ambitions of a far-right Donald Trump loyalist as voters came out in force to ensure that the Black Sea nation held steady on a pro-European path.
item.dc:creator: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu

media:content.media:description: Nicusor Dan greets supporters following the first exit poll results, at an election night rally in Bucharest, Romania, on May 18, 2025. Photographer: Andrei Pungovschi/Getty Images

item.title: Clock Ticks on Hostage Talks as Israel Gears Up Gaza Sweep
item.description: Israeli officials say they’re poised to order tanks and troops into unconquered parts of the Gaza Strip in an all-out bid to destroy Hamas, throwing an ultimatum at the Palestinian Islamist faction to concede on terms for a negotiated winding down of the war.
item.dc:creator: Dan Williams

media:content.media:description: This picture taken from a position in southern Israel shows Israeli tanks deployed on the border with the Gaza Strip on May 17, 2025. The Israeli military announced the early stages of an intensified operation in Gaza aimed at defeating Hamas, with rescuers in the beseiged Palestinian territory reporting 10 killed on May 17 in fresh Israeli strikes. (Photo by Jack GUEZ / AFP) (Photo by JACK GUEZ/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Portugal’s Premier Wins Election, Misses Majority: Exit Polls
item.description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s center-right coalition won a snap election on Sunday, gaining a few more seats in parliament but still falling short of an absolute majority, exit polls showed.
item.dc:creator: Joao Lima, Henrique Almeida

media:content.media:description: Luis Montenegro arrives for the election night with his wife Carla Montenegro in Lisbon on May 18.

item.title: Biden Diagnosed With Aggressive Prostate Cancer, NYT Reports
item.description: Former US President Joe Biden was diagnosed last week with an aggressive form of prostate cancer, the New York Times reported Sunday, citing a spokesperson.
item.dc:creator: Alan Goldstein

media:content.media:description: US President Joe Biden during the Conference of Mayors in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, Jan. 17, 2025. Biden's $52 billion bid to transform the domestic chip industry, one of the most ambitious pieces of US industrial policy since World War II, is about to enter a pivotal stage: life under a new administration.

item.title: Hungarians Protest Orban Plans to Crush Civil Society, Media
item.description: Hungarians demonstrated in Budapest against Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s escalating campaign to muzzle critics less than a year before elections.
item.dc:creator: Zoltan Simon

media:content.media:description: Demonstrators protest a bill to cut foreign funding to civil society and media threat to Hungary’s sovereignty, in central Budapest on May 18.

item.title: Houthis Say They Plan to Target Israeli Airports in Coming Hours
item.description: Yemen’s Houthi rebels announced that they would carry out in the coming few hours military operations targeting Ben Gurion and other airports in Israel, in response to the Israeli escalation in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Mohammed Hatem

media:content.media:description: An El Al Israel Airlines and a HiSky jet at Ben Gurion airport in Tel Aviv, Israel, on Wednesday, Aug. 7, 2024. Iran has said it wants to punish Israel for last week’s assassination of a leading Hamas figure in Tehran, but not to the point of starting a region-wide war.

item.title: Meloni to See Vance, Von Der Leyen as Leaders Gather in Rome
item.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni hailed a “new beginning” in transatlantic relations as she hosted US Vice President JD Vance and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen to talk about trade, tariffs and security.
item.dc:creator: Donato Paolo Mancini

media:content.media:description: Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, hosts, US Vice President JD Vance and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen at the Chigi Palace in Rome on May 18.

item.title: Zelenskiy Meets Vance, Rubio Ahead of Trump-Putin Call
item.description: US Vice President JD Vance held talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Rome on Sunday at a time Washington is pressing for a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Donato Paolo Mancini, Flavia Rotondi

media:content.media:description: Zelenskiy, center left, greets Vance at the inaugural mass of Pope Leo XIV in St. Peter’s Square in Vatican City on Sunday.

item.title: Ramaphosa Walks a Diplomatic Tightrope in Risky Trump Meeting
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa will meet Donald Trump this week after months of criticism from the US president, but some advisers fear he risks a Volodymyr Zelenskiy-style dressing down in the Oval Office.
item.dc:creator: S'thembile Cele

media:content.media:description: Cyril Ramaphosa during the G20 Foreign Minister Meeting in Johannesburg.

item.title: French Regulator Tells Airlines to Cut Orly Flights After Glitch
item.description: France’s civil aviation regulator asked airlines to reduce their flight schedules at Paris-Orly airport by 40% by the end of Sunday after air traffic control systems suffered a failure.
item.dc:creator: Francois De Beaupuy

media:content.media:description: Passengers in the departures hall at Paris-Orly Airport, operated by Aeroports de Paris, in Paris, France, on Tuesday, Feb. 27, 2024. Air France-KLM report earnings on Feb. 29.

item.title: Bessent Calls Moody’s ‘Lagging Indicator’ of US Fiscal Health
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent downplayed concerns over the US’s government debt and the inflationary impact of tariffs on companies including Walmart Inc., saying the Trump administration is determined to lower federal spending and grow the economy.
item.dc:creator: Brendan Murray

media:content.media:description: Scott Bessent, US treasury secretary, during a House Financial Services Committee hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Bessent said he’s working with US legislators on outbound investment rules for China that would make clear what’s allowed and what’s not.

item.title: Iran Vows to Uphold Pursuit of Peaceful Nuclear Energy
item.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said his country won’t abandon its pursuit of civilian nuclear energy under any circumstances, while reiterating that Tehran has no intention of developing nuclear weapons.
item.dc:creator: Arsalan Shahla

media:content.media:description: The Bushehr nuclear power plant in Bushehr province, Iran.
